data.title: JJR Solutions Wins $25B VA Vector Contract — JJR Solutions
data.meta_description: Dayton, Ohio — The U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs (VA) has awarded JJR Solutions a Veteran Enterprise Contracting for Transformation and Operational Readiness (VECTOR) Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract.  This 10-year, $25B, multiple-award IDIQ covers a broad range of manage
data.text:
Dayton, Ohio — The U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs (VA) has awarded JJR Solutions a Veteran Enterprise Contracting for Transformation and Operational Readiness (VECTOR) Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract.

This 10-year, $25B, multiple-award IDIQ covers a broad range of management and business services and solutions that ultimately serve Veterans and their families. JJR teamed with nine other Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses (SDVOSBs) from across the nation to win the award and will compete for task orders in two of VECTOR’s five service groups: Group 1 – Management, Oversight, and Improvement; and Group 2 – Analysis.

The JJR team is the only Ohio-based team among the 68 companies receiving award.

“This contract is a game changer for Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses like JJR,” said JJR President and CEO David Judson, Jr. “Successful awardees will likely experience significant growth as a result. We are thrilled with the award and look forward to supporting the VA’s critical mission for our Veterans and their families.”

ABOUT JJR SOLUTIONS
